page.title: 01Middleton on the Wolds
page.content: Middleton on the Wolds is a thriving village with a population of 640, situated on the edge of the Yorkshire Wolds. It is surrounded by largely arable farming land. The village has grown considerably since the 1970's when a new house building programme was started, catering for peop@le who commute to work in nearby towns and cities, including Hull and Beverley. The primary school also serves the neighbouring villages of north Dalton and Bainton. The largest employment site is a poultry and game supplier. Despite or because of the increased growth of the village, there remains a strong community spirit, which is evident by the number of activities which cater for a wide range of groups and clubs, including play groups, youth clubs, Yorkshire Countrywomens Assoc.,scouts & guides & sport clubs.
